00190 /* a sequence of these are used */
00191 typedef struct x509_attributes_st
00192     {
00193     ASN1_OBJECT *object;
00194     int single; /* 0 for a set, 1 for a single item (which is wrong) */
00195     union   {
00196         char        *ptr;
00197 /* 0 */     STACK_OF(ASN1_TYPE) *set;
00198 /* 1 */     ASN1_TYPE   *single;
00199         } value;
00200     } X509_ATTRIBUTE;

00224 typedef struct x509_cinf_st
00225     {
00226     ASN1_INTEGER *version;      /* [ 0 ] default of v1 */
00227     ASN1_INTEGER *serialNumber;
00228     X509_ALGOR *signature;
00229     X509_NAME *issuer;
00230     X509_VAL *validity;
00231     X509_NAME *subject;
00232     X509_PUBKEY *key;
00233     ASN1_BIT_STRING *issuerUID;     /* [ 1 ] optional in v2 */
00234     ASN1_BIT_STRING *subjectUID;        /* [ 2 ] optional in v2 */
00235     STACK_OF(X509_EXTENSION) *extensions;   /* [ 3 ] optional in v3 */
00236     } X509_CINF;

00238 /* This stuff is certificate "auxiliary info"
00239  * it contains details which are useful in certificate
00240  * stores and databases. When used this is tagged onto
00241  * the end of the certificate itself
00242  */
00243 
00244 typedef struct x509_cert_aux_st
00245     {
00246     STACK_OF(ASN1_OBJECT) *trust;       /* trusted uses */
00247     STACK_OF(ASN1_OBJECT) *reject;      /* rejected uses */
00248     ASN1_UTF8STRING *alias;         /* "friendly name" */
00249     ASN1_OCTET_STRING *keyid;       /* key id of private key */
00250     STACK_OF(X509_ALGOR) *other;        /* other unspecified info */
00251     } X509_CERT_AUX;
00252 
00253 struct x509_st
00254     {
00255     X509_CINF *cert_info;
00256     X509_ALGOR *sig_alg;
00257     ASN1_BIT_STRING *signature;
00258     int valid;
00259     int references;
00260     char *name;
00261     CRYPTO_EX_DATA ex_data;
00262     /* These contain copies of various extension values */
00263     long ex_pathlen;
00264     unsigned long ex_flags;
00265     unsigned long ex_kusage;
00266     unsigned long ex_xkusage;
00267     unsigned long ex_nscert;
00268     ASN1_OCTET_STRING *skid;
00269     struct AUTHORITY_KEYID_st *akid;
00270 #ifndef OPENSSL_NO_SHA
00271     unsigned char sha1_hash[SHA_DIGEST_LENGTH];
00272 #endif
00273     X509_CERT_AUX *aux;
00274     } /* X509 */;

00292 /* standard trust ids */
00293 
00294 #define X509_TRUST_DEFAULT  -1  /* Only valid in purpose settings */
00295 
00296 #define X509_TRUST_COMPAT   1
00297 #define X509_TRUST_SSL_CLIENT   2
00298 #define X509_TRUST_SSL_SERVER   3
00299 #define X509_TRUST_EMAIL    4
00300 #define X509_TRUST_OBJECT_SIGN  5
00301 #define X509_TRUST_OCSP_SIGN    6
00302 #define X509_TRUST_OCSP_REQUEST 7
00303 
00304 /* Keep these up to date! */
00305 #define X509_TRUST_MIN      1
00306 #define X509_TRUST_MAX      7
00307 
00308 
00309 /* trust_flags values */
00310 #define X509_TRUST_DYNAMIC  1
00311 #define X509_TRUST_DYNAMIC_NAME 2
00312 
00313 /* check_trust return codes */
00314 
00315 #define X509_TRUST_TRUSTED  1
00316 #define X509_TRUST_REJECTED 2
00317 #define X509_TRUST_UNTRUSTED    3
00318 
00319 /* Flags for X509_print_ex() */
00320 
00321 #define X509_FLAG_COMPAT        0
00322 #define X509_FLAG_NO_HEADER     1L
00323 #define X509_FLAG_NO_VERSION        (1L << 1)
00324 #define X509_FLAG_NO_SERIAL     (1L << 2)
00325 #define X509_FLAG_NO_SIGNAME        (1L << 3)
00326 #define X509_FLAG_NO_ISSUER     (1L << 4)
00327 #define X509_FLAG_NO_VALIDITY       (1L << 5)
00328 #define X509_FLAG_NO_SUBJECT        (1L << 6)
00329 #define X509_FLAG_NO_PUBKEY     (1L << 7)
00330 #define X509_FLAG_NO_EXTENSIONS     (1L << 8)
00331 #define X509_FLAG_NO_SIGDUMP        (1L << 9)
00332 #define X509_FLAG_NO_AUX        (1L << 10)
00333 #define X509_FLAG_NO_ATTRIBUTES     (1L << 11)
00334 
00335 /* Flags specific to X509_NAME_print_ex() */    
00336 
00337 /* The field separator information */
00338 
00339 #define XN_FLAG_SEP_MASK    (0xf << 16)
00340 
00341 #define XN_FLAG_COMPAT      0       /* Traditional SSLeay: use old X509_NAME_print */
00342 #define XN_FLAG_SEP_COMMA_PLUS  (1 << 16)   /* RFC2253 ,+ */
00343 #define XN_FLAG_SEP_CPLUS_SPC   (2 << 16)   /* ,+ spaced: more readable */
00344 #define XN_FLAG_SEP_SPLUS_SPC   (3 << 16)   /* ;+ spaced */
00345 #define XN_FLAG_SEP_MULTILINE   (4 << 16)   /* One line per field */
00346 
00347 #define XN_FLAG_DN_REV      (1 << 20)   /* Reverse DN order */
00348 
00349 /* How the field name is shown */
00350 
00351 #define XN_FLAG_FN_MASK     (0x3 << 21)
00352 
00353 #define XN_FLAG_FN_SN       0       /* Object short name */
00354 #define XN_FLAG_FN_LN       (1 << 21)   /* Object long name */
00355 #define XN_FLAG_FN_OID      (2 << 21)   /* Always use OIDs */
00356 #define XN_FLAG_FN_NONE     (3 << 21)   /* No field names */
00357 
00358 #define XN_FLAG_SPC_EQ      (1 << 23)   /* Put spaces round '=' */
00359 
00360 /* This determines if we dump fields we don't recognise:
00361  * RFC2253 requires this.
00362  */
00363 
00364 #define XN_FLAG_DUMP_UNKNOWN_FIELDS (1 << 24)
00365 
00366 #define XN_FLAG_FN_ALIGN    (1 << 25)   /* Align field names to 20 characters */
00367 
00368 /* Complete set of RFC2253 flags */
00369 
00370 #define XN_FLAG_RFC2253 (ASN1_STRFLGS_RFC2253 | \
00371             XN_FLAG_SEP_COMMA_PLUS | \
00372             XN_FLAG_DN_REV | \
00373             XN_FLAG_FN_SN | \
00374             XN_FLAG_DUMP_UNKNOWN_FIELDS)
00375 
00376 /* readable oneline form */
00377 
00378 #define XN_FLAG_ONELINE (ASN1_STRFLGS_RFC2253 | \
00379             ASN1_STRFLGS_ESC_QUOTE | \
00380             XN_FLAG_SEP_CPLUS_SPC | \
00381             XN_FLAG_SPC_EQ | \
00382             XN_FLAG_FN_SN)
00383 
00384 /* readable multiline form */
00385 
00386 #define XN_FLAG_MULTILINE (ASN1_STRFLGS_ESC_CTRL | \
00387             ASN1_STRFLGS_ESC_MSB | \
00388             XN_FLAG_SEP_MULTILINE | \
00389             XN_FLAG_SPC_EQ | \
00390             XN_FLAG_FN_LN | \
00391             XN_FLAG_FN_ALIGN)
00392

00427 typedef struct private_key_st
00428     {
00429     int version;
00430     /* The PKCS#8 data types */
00431     X509_ALGOR *enc_algor;
00432     ASN1_OCTET_STRING *enc_pkey;    /* encrypted pub key */
00433 
00434     /* When decrypted, the following will not be NULL */
00435     EVP_PKEY *dec_pkey;
00436 
00437     /* used to encrypt and decrypt */
00438     int key_length;
00439     char *key_data;
00440     int key_free;   /* true if we should auto free key_data */
00441 
00442     /* expanded version of 'enc_algor' */
00443     EVP_CIPHER_INFO cipher;
00444 
00445     int references;
00446     } X509_PKEY;

00465 /* The next 2 structures and their 8 routines were sent to me by
00466  * Pat Richard <patr@x509.com> and are used to manipulate
00467  * Netscapes spki structures - useful if you are writing a CA web page
00468  */
00469 typedef struct Netscape_spkac_st
00470     {
00471     X509_PUBKEY *pubkey;
00472     ASN1_IA5STRING *challenge;  /* challenge sent in atlas >= PR2 */
00473     } NETSCAPE_SPKAC;
00474 
00475 typedef struct Netscape_spki_st
00476     {
00477     NETSCAPE_SPKAC *spkac;  /* signed public key and challenge */
00478     X509_ALGOR *sig_algor;
00479     ASN1_BIT_STRING *signature;
00480     } NETSCAPE_SPKI;

00518 /* PKCS#8 private key info structure */
00519 
00520 typedef struct pkcs8_priv_key_info_st
00521         {
00522         int broken;     /* Flag for various broken formats */
00523 #define PKCS8_OK        0
00524 #define PKCS8_NO_OCTET      1
00525 #define PKCS8_EMBEDDED_PARAM    2
00526 #define PKCS8_NS_DB     3
00527         ASN1_INTEGER *version;
00528         X509_ALGOR *pkeyalg;
00529         ASN1_TYPE *pkey; /* Should be OCTET STRING but some are broken */
00530         STACK_OF(X509_ATTRIBUTE) *attributes;
00531         } PKCS8_PRIV_KEY_INFO;

00544 #ifdef SSLEAY_MACROS
00545 #define X509_verify(a,r) ASN1_verify((int (*)())i2d_X509_CINF,a->sig_alg,\
00546     a->signature,(char *)a->cert_info,r)
00547 #define X509_REQ_verify(a,r) ASN1_verify((int (*)())i2d_X509_REQ_INFO, \
00548     a->sig_alg,a->signature,(char *)a->req_info,r)
00549 #define X509_CRL_verify(a,r) ASN1_verify((int (*)())i2d_X509_CRL_INFO, \
00550     a->sig_alg, a->signature,(char *)a->crl,r)
00551 
00552 #define X509_sign(x,pkey,md) \
00553     ASN1_sign((int (*)())i2d_X509_CINF, x->cert_info->signature, \
00554         x->sig_alg, x->signature, (char *)x->cert_info,pkey,md)
00555 #define X509_REQ_sign(x,pkey,md) \
00556     ASN1_sign((int (*)())i2d_X509_REQ_INFO,x->sig_alg, NULL, \
00557         x->signature, (char *)x->req_info,pkey,md)
00558 #define X509_CRL_sign(x,pkey,md) \
00559     ASN1_sign((int (*)())i2d_X509_CRL_INFO,x->crl->sig_alg,x->sig_alg, \
00560         x->signature, (char *)x->crl,pkey,md)
00561 #define NETSCAPE_SPKI_sign(x,pkey,md) \
00562     ASN1_sign((int (*)())i2d_NETSCAPE_SPKAC, x->sig_algor,NULL, \
00563         x->signature, (char *)x->spkac,pkey,md)
00564 
00565 #define X509_dup(x509) (X509 *)ASN1_dup((int (*)())i2d_X509, \
00566         (char *(*)())d2i_X509,(char *)x509)
00567 #define X509_ATTRIBUTE_dup(xa) (X509_ATTRIBUTE *)ASN1_dup(\
00568         (int (*)())i2d_X509_ATTRIBUTE, \
00569         (char *(*)())d2i_X509_ATTRIBUTE,(char *)xa)
00570 #define X509_EXTENSION_dup(ex) (X509_EXTENSION *)ASN1_dup( \
00571         (int (*)())i2d_X509_EXTENSION, \
00572         (char *(*)())d2i_X509_EXTENSION,(char *)ex)
00573 #define d2i_X509_fp(fp,x509) (X509 *)ASN1_d2i_fp((char *(*)())X509_new, \
00574         (char *(*)())d2i_X509, (fp),(unsigned char **)(x509))
00575 #define i2d_X509_fp(fp,x509) ASN1_i2d_fp(i2d_X509,fp,(unsigned char *)x509)
00576 #define d2i_X509_bio(bp,x509) (X509 *)ASN1_d2i_bio((char *(*)())X509_new, \
